title: July 2013 FQE - Paper 1
description: Final Qualifying Examination for Diploma in Clinical Medicine and Surgery - Paediatrics Paper 1 (July 2013). Covers Short Answer Questions (SAQs) and Essay Questions.

questions.question: A 1-year-old child (10kg) presents with 3 days of D&V. Exam: Lethargic, Cold hands/feet, Capillary refill >3s, Weak pulse. Select the correct diagnosis and initial management.

richContent.content:
Case: 1yo, 10kg.
History: Diarrhea & Vomiting x3 days.
Signs: Lethargic, Cold extremities, CRT >3s, Weak pulse.

options.text: Give IV Bolus 20ml/kg (200ml) Normal Saline immediately
Reassess after bolus; repeat if shock persists
Start Plan C rehydration (100ml/kg) after shock resolves

questions.explanation: This is Hypovolemic Shock. Immediate resuscitation with IV fluid bolus (20ml/kg) is required. Once stable, proceed to Plan C rehydration.
questions.hint: Treat the shock first with a bolus.

questions.question: Regarding Anemia in Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM), select the correct management principles.

options.text: Give Blood Transfusion if Hb < 4 g/dL
Give Blood Transfusion if Hb < 6 g/dL with respiratory distress
Start Oral Iron immediately on admission
Start Oral Iron only in rehabilitation phase (after day 7)

questions.explanation: Iron is contraindicated in the stabilization phase of SAM as it promotes bacterial growth/sepsis. Transfusion is reserved for severe anemia (<4) or with distress (<6).
questions.hint: No iron in the first week.

questions.question: Otieno (4yo) presents with fever, vomiting, and convulsions despite prior malaria treatment. Exam: Febrile, AVPU=P, Convulsing. Select the likely differentials and 1st line treatment.
questions.explanation: Severe Malaria or Meningitis are top differentials. IV Artesunate is the treatment of choice for severe malaria. Diazepam controls seizures.
questions.hint: Unconscious febrile child needs parenteral antimalarial.

questions.question: A newborn (1.8kg) delivered at home 2 days ago presents cold, with blue lips and weak cry. Select the correct signs, complications, and management.
questions.explanation: The baby is Premature/LBW, Hypothermic, and Cyanosed. Needs warmth, oxygen, and sugar monitoring. Hypothermia is a major killer.

questions.question: A 3-year-old (7kg) presents with edema, wounds, and shock. History of neglect/abuse. Diagnosis: SAM + Shock. How do you manage fluid resuscitation?

options.text: Give IV 15ml/kg of Half Strength Darrow's/5% Dextrose over 1 hour
Give IV Normal Saline 20ml/kg bolus immediately
Monitor pulse and respiration every 10 mins

questions.explanation: Shock in SAM is treated cautiously with 15ml/kg over 1 hour using HSD/5%D. Standard resuscitation (20-30ml/kg bolus) causes heart failure.

questions.question: What is the definitive diagnostic test for Sickle Cell Disease?
questions.explanation: Hb Electrophoresis separates Hb types (HbS, HbA, HbF) and confirms the diagnosis. Sickling test is a screen.

questions.question: Which hormone stimulates red blood cell production?
questions.explanation: EPO is produced by the kidneys in response to hypoxia and stimulates bone marrow to produce RBCs.
